item.title: [DERBY-6247] updatelocksJDBC30 test failing in nightly regression tests
item.description:
updatelocksJDBC30 test failed intermittently in nightly regression tests, trunk, ibm16
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/main/windows/testlog/ibm16/1488447-derbyall_diff.txt

                  • Diff file derbyall/encryptionAll/storemats/storemats/updatelocksJDBC30.diff
      • Start: updatelocksJDBC30 jdk1.6.0 storemats:storemats 2013-05-31 19:48:20 ***

        < APP |UserTransaction|ROW |1 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
        15112a15112
        > APP |UserTransaction|ROW |2 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
        15125d15124

        15142a15142
        > APP |UserTransaction|ROW |2 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
        Test Failed.
      • End: updatelocksJDBC30 jdk1.6.0 storemats:storemats 2013-05-31 19:48:32 ***

item.summary: updatelocksJDBC30 test failing in nightly regression tests

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Failed again, 10.8, windows, ibm15:
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/v10_8/windows/testlog/ibm15/1495658-derbyall_diff.txt

Failed again: http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/v10_10/windows/testlog/ibm16/1517407-derbyall_diff.txt with the following diff:

                  • Diff file derbyall/encryptionAll/storemats/storemats/updatelocksJDBC30.diff
      • Start: updatelocksJDBC30 jdk1.6.0 storemats:storemats 2013-08-25 20:42:17 ***
        4209a4210

      • End: updatelocksJDBC30 jdk1.6.0 storemats:storemats 2013-08-25 20:42:38 ***

Failed again, this time on 10.8.3.1 - (1550870) with ibm jdk 1.6 on Windows machine
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/v10_8/windows/testlog/ibm16/1550870-derbyall_diff.txt

                  • Diff file derbyall/storeall/storemats/storemats/updatelocksJDBC30.diff
      • Start: updatelocksJDBC30 jdk1.6.0 storemats:storemats 2013-12-13 22:31:40 ***
        9850a9851
        > APP |UserTran|ROW |1 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
        9862a9864
        > APP |UserTran|ROW |1 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
        9871a9874
        > APP |UserTran|ROW |1 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE

      • End: updatelocksJDBC30 jdk1.6.0 storemats:storemats 2013-12-13 22:32:05 ***

failed 1/10/2014, windows, ibm 1.6, 10.11.0.0 alpha (1557303).
9850a9851
> APP |UserTransaction|ROW |1 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
9862a9864
> APP |UserTransaction|ROW |1 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
9871a9874
> APP |UserTransaction|ROW |1 |U |A |(1,7) |GRANT|ACTIVE
Test Failed.
see: http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/main/windows/testlog/ibm16/1557303-derbyall_diff.txt

I think the problems can be prevented, or at least we can get better control over the test if the test gets converted to junit.

I think this can be achieved by adding parameters to the current methods in the UpdateLocksTest - which has already been converted.

I found the following differences between the original (I looked at the 10.7 branch versions) updatelocks.sql and updatelocksJDBC30.sql and related files:

  • the cursors in updatelocksJDBC30.sql were created as 'get hold cursor'
  • the test did not execute any of the 'non cursor' runs
  • the test did not execute a section for READ_UNCOMMITTED
  • the test did not have any wait_for_post_commit calls

I think it is feasible to integrate the two tests now.

Also, I think the test should run in client-server mode as well as in embedded mode.
Finally the test needs to run in an encryption as well, the original test ran in storemats which is part of the encryption suite, which has the following properties:
testEncryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/NoPadding
testJavaFlags=testDataEncryption=Thursday
It looks like the encryption part has fallen by the wayside during the conversion of updatelocks.sql.
(Note: I tried to run the UpdateLocksTest.suite as part of EncryptionSuite, similar to how AccessTest.suite() is run there, but UpdateLocksTest needs SQL objects set up and requires a SystemPropertySetup for the pagesize, or all scans flop to be tablescans. So I'll try it as part of the test itself).

Attaching a patch which merges the functionality of updatelocksJDBC30 into the already converted UpdateLocksTest.
Also making the test run with client/server as well as embedded.
Removes the storemats test because this is now empty.

I attached a patch that converts the test.
I played with making the test run with encryption because the original test did, but the setup does not make this pretty.
I think the original test was running in encryption because it was easy to do in that test harness, I don't think there is a technical reason for thinking the behavior of the locks would be different with encryption. Except perhaps that the pages might work to a different size, but in the case of this test, the page size is set and the data sets are so small I don't think it would matter. So I am abandoning that attempt for now.
The test now does run with DerbyNetClient/Network Server.
I'll commit this shortly - if there are comments they can be addressed later.

Commit 1629099 from myrna in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629099 ]

DERBY-6247; updatelocksJDBC30 test failing in nightly regression tests
addressing the issue by merging the test into junit test UdateLocksTest.java

I intend to backport this to 10.11.
I checked that we still have ij tests that create with hold cursors and we do: lang/holdCursorIJ.sql.

Commit 1629334 from myrna in branch 'code/branches/10.11'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629334 ]

DERBY-6247; updatelocksJDBC30 test failing in nightly regression tests
backport of revision 1629099 from trunk

Commit 1629705 from myrna in branch 'code/branches/10.10'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1629705 ]

DERBY-6247; updatelocksJDBC30 test failing in nightly regression tests
backport of revision 162099 from 10.11 branch.

I backported this to 10.10.
If we should see another intermittent test failure like this (in one of the JDBC30 tests of UpdateLocksTest) a new bug can be opened and we can modify the test to look for the specific expected locks and ignore other locks.

I don't intend to backport this further.
[ Automatically closing all resolved issues that haven't been updated in more than six months. ]
